decBusConfigTable.name: decBusConfigTable
decBusConfigTable.description: A table which describes all the Broadcast and Unknown Server components implemented by this managed device.

decBusConfigEntry.name: decBusConfigEntry
decBusConfigEntry.description: Each row of the table describes a standalone BUS or a component of a BUS.

decBusIndex.name: decBusIndex
decBusIndex.description: A unique number greater than zero which identifies this table row.

decBusRowStatus.name: decBusRowStatus
decBusRowStatus.description: This object is used to create and delete Broadcast and Unknown Server components. If this object is writable, it will accept the values 'createAndGo' 'destroy' under suitable conditions. Use decBusAdminStatus to enable and disable service.

decBusAdminStatus.name: decBusAdminStatus
decBusAdminStatus.description: The desired state of this BUS component. When a BUS is distributed, this object controls the 'local' server component, as opposed to the overall state of the BUS. If a LES is connected to the BUS, enabling/disabling either server may affect both of them. Otherwise it is up to the network manager to coordinate the state of the servers.

decBusOperStatus.name: decBusOperStatus
decBusOperStatus.description: The operational state of this BUS component. A BUS component may not become operational until it has been configured with values for LAN Type Maximum Data Frame Size Maximum Frame Age When a BUS is in the 'disabling' or 'deleting' state, attempts to set decBusAdminStatus to 'up' will fail.

decBusLastChange.name: decBusLastChange
decBusLastChange.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time that this server last entered its current operational state. If the current state was entered prior to the last re-initialization of the local network management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value.

decBusAtmAddress.name: decBusAtmAddress
decBusAtmAddress.description: The ATM address of this Broadcast and Unknown Server, or Broadcast and Unknown Server component. Clients establish Multicast Send VCCs to this address as part of the BUS Connect phase of LAN Emulation.

decBusDescription.name: decBusDescription
decBusDescription.description: A human-readable string which can contain anything the network manager wants.

decBusLanName.name: decBusLanName
decBusLanName.reference: ATM Forum LAN Emulation Over ATM Specification, V1.0, Section 5.1.1
decBusLanName.description: The name of this emulated LAN. While not required for operational purposes, providing a LAN Name may make it easier to keep track of which BUS component is which. This string is not guaranteed to uniquely identify the emulated LAN.

decBusLanType.name: decBusLanType
decBusLanType.reference: ATM Forum LAN Emulation Over ATM Specification, V1.0, Section 5.1.2
decBusLanType.description: The data frame format (or LAN-TYPE) for the emulated LAN this Broadcast and Unknown Server supports. In an active emulated LAN, this parameter MUST have a consistent value in all of the LES and BUS components serving the emulated LAN. Otherwise, problems may result. This columnar object's value may only be changed when 'decBus[Admin,Oper]Status' are 'down'.

decBusMaxDataFrameSize.name: decBusMaxDataFrameSize
decBusMaxDataFrameSize.reference: ATM Forum LAN Emulation Over ATM Specification, V1.0, Section 5.1.2
decBusMaxDataFrameSize.description: The maximum AAL-5 SDU size for data frames sent over this emulated LAN. This must be one of the standard sizes defined in the LAN Emulation specification, in other words either 1516, 4544, 9234, or 18190 octets. In an active emulated LAN, this parameter MUST have a consistent value in all of the LES and BUS components serving the emulated LAN. Otherwise, problems may result. This columnar object's value may only be changed when 'decBus[Admin,Oper]Status' are 'down'.

decBusMaxFrameAge.name: decBusMaxFrameAge
decBusMaxFrameAge.reference: ATM Forum LAN Emulation Over ATM Specification, V1.0, Section 5.1.2
decBusMaxFrameAge.description: The maximum amount of time which this Broadcast and Unknown Server can hold a frame before being forced to either forward or discard it. If a BUS is distributed, each of its servers should have the same value for this parameter.

decBusMaxForwardingRate.name: decBusMaxForwardingRate
decBusMaxForwardingRate.description: The maximum rate at which this Broadcast and Unknown Server will forward frames.

decBusClientStatesTable.name: decBusClientStatesTable
decBusClientStatesTable.description: A table describing how many clients are in various membership states.

decBusClientStatesEntry.name: decBusClientStatesEntry
decBusClientStatesEntry.description: Each row contains counters for one BUS component.

decBusActiveClients.name: decBusActiveClients
decBusActiveClients.description: The number of active clients of this BUS component. This count only includes those clients which have both Multicast Send and Multicast Forward VCCs.

decBusMulticastFwdInProgress.name: decBusMulticastFwdInProgress
decBusMulticastFwdInProgress.description: The number of clients to which this BUS component is currently establishing Multicast Forward VCCs.

decBusTerminating.name: decBusTerminating
decBusTerminating.description: The number of clients whose memberships this BUS component is in the process of terminating.

decBusTrafficTable.name: decBusTrafficTable
decBusTrafficTable.description: A table of traffic statistics, with one row for each Broadcast and Unknown Server.

decBusTrafficEntry.name: decBusTrafficEntry
decBusTrafficEntry.description: A set of traffic statistics for one BUS component.

decBusFramesForwarded.name: decBusFramesForwarded
decBusFramesForwarded.description: The number of frames successfully forwarded by this Broadcast and Unknown Server.

decBusInvalidFrames.name: decBusInvalidFrames
decBusInvalidFrames.description: The number of frames which were discarded because of errors (such as invalid frame length).

decBusFramesAgedOut.name: decBusFramesAgedOut
decBusFramesAgedOut.description: The number of frames which were discarded because delay exceeded the Maximum Frame Age.

decBusFramesRateLimited.name: decBusFramesRateLimited
decBusFramesRateLimited.description: The number of frames which were discarded in order to enforce 'decBusMaxForwardingRate'.

decBusFramesDiscarded.name: decBusFramesDiscarded
decBusFramesDiscarded.description: The number of frames which could not be forwarded, even though no errors had been detected, and the frames had not aged out.

decBusClientTable.name: decBusClientTable
decBusClientTable.description: A table listing clients of the emulated LANs which this node serves. This table reflects the actual membership of each emulated LAN, as opposed to the desired membership.

decBusClientEntry.name: decBusClientEntry
decBusClientEntry.description: Each entry describes an active LAN Emulation Client, from the perspective of the BUS.

decBusClientIndex.name: decBusClientIndex
decBusClientIndex.description: A unique value for each table row. This value has no predefined relation to a client's LECID.

decBusClientAtmAddress.name: decBusClientAtmAddress
decBusClientAtmAddress.description: The primary ATM address of the LAN Emulation Client.

decBusClientID.name: decBusClientID
decBusClientID.description: Contains the first LECID the appropriate BUS has seen for this client, or zero if none has been seen yet.

decBusClientUsedSeveralIDs.name: decBusClientUsedSeveralIDs
decBusClientUsedSeveralIDs.description: Indicates whether the appropriate BUS has seen two or more non-zero LEC IDs for this client. This is not a normal condition, and it would usually arise due to a transmission error in a frame or due to a client that was violating the LAN Emulation specification.

decBusClientState.name: decBusClientState
decBusClientState.description: Indicates the status of this LEC from the server's perspective.

decBusClientRowStatus.name: decBusClientRowStatus
decBusClientRowStatus.description: Provides a way to disconnect a LEC from the BUS. When read, this object has the value 'active'. When written, it only accepts the value 'destroy'. Because the ability to disconnect clients could lead to denial-of-service attacks, support for this feature is strictly optional.

decBusLecTable.name: decBusLecTable
decBusLecTable.description: A table listing clients which belong to the emulated LANs that this node serves.

decBusLecEntry.name: decBusLecEntry
decBusLecEntry.description: Each entry describes a LAN Emulation Client from the perspective of the BUS.

decBusLecAtmAddress.name: decBusLecAtmAddress
decBusLecAtmAddress.description: The primary ATM address of the LAN Emulation Client.

decBusLecIndex.name: decBusLecIndex
decBusLecIndex.description: The client's index in the 'decBusClientTable'. Note that this value is NOT the client's LEC-ID.

decBusLecID.name: decBusLecID
decBusLecID.description: Contains the first LECID the appropriate BUS has seen for this client, or zero if none has been seen yet.

decBusLecUsedSeveralIDs.name: decBusLecUsedSeveralIDs
decBusLecUsedSeveralIDs.description: Indicates whether the appropriate BUS has seen two or more non-zero LEC IDs for this client. This is not a normal condition, and it would usually arise due to a transmission error in a frame or due to a client that was violating the LAN Emulation specification.

decBusLecState.name: decBusLecState
decBusLecState.description: Indicates the status of this LEC from the server's perspective.

decBusLecRowStatus.name: decBusLecRowStatus
decBusLecRowStatus.description: Provides a way to disconnect a LEC from the BUS. When read, this object has the value 'active'. When written, it only accepts the value 'destroy'. Because the ability to disconnect clients could lead to denial-of-service attacks, support for this feature is strictly optional.

decBusMulticastSendTable.name: decBusMulticastSendTable
decBusMulticastSendTable.description: This optional table identifies Multicast Send VCCs at the place where they attach to the BUS. In a SVC implementation, the objects in this table will be read-only. In a PVC implementation, this table can be used to tell the BUS about the creation or the deletion of Multicast Send VCCs.

decBusMulticastSendEntry.name: decBusMulticastSendEntry
decBusMulticastSendEntry.description: Each entry describes the circuits going to one LAN Emulation Client.

decBusMulticastSendInterface.name: decBusMulticastSendInterface
decBusMulticastSendInterface.description: If a Multicast Send PVC or SVC exists, this object has a value equal to the 'ifIndex' of the ATM port which terminates that circuit at the BUS. Otherwise it has the value 0.

decBusMulticastSendVpi.name: decBusMulticastSendVpi
decBusMulticastSendVpi.description: If a Multicast Send PVC or SVC exists, this object has a value equal to the VPI of the Multicast Send VCC at the point where it connects to the BUS. Otherwise, it has the value 0.

decBusMulticastSendVci.name: decBusMulticastSendVci
decBusMulticastSendVci.description: If a Multicast Send PVC or SVC exists, this object has a value equal to the VCI of the Multicast Send VCC at the point where it connects to the BUS. Otherwise, it has the value 0.

decBusMulticastSendRowStatus.name: decBusMulticastSendRowStatus
decBusMulticastSendRowStatus.description: Used to create and delete rows in the table.

decBusMulticastFwdTable.name: decBusMulticastFwdTable
decBusMulticastFwdTable.description: This optional table identifies Multicast Forward VCCs at the place where they attach to the BUS. In a SVC implementation, this table will be read- only. In a PVC implementation, this table can be used to tell the BUS about the creation or the deletion of Multicast Forward VCCs.

decBusMulticastFwdEntry.name: decBusMulticastFwdEntry
decBusMulticastFwdEntry.description: Each entry describes the circuits going to one LAN Emulation Client.

decBusMulticastFwdInterface.name: decBusMulticastFwdInterface
decBusMulticastFwdInterface.description: The 'ifIndex' of the ATM port which terminates the Multicast Forward VCC at the BUS.

decBusMulticastFwdVpi.name: decBusMulticastFwdVpi
decBusMulticastFwdVpi.description: The VPI of the Multicast Forward VCC at the point where this VCC connects to the BUS.

decBusMulticastFwdVci.name: decBusMulticastFwdVci
decBusMulticastFwdVci.description: The VCI of the Multicast Forward VCC at the point where this VCC connects to the BUS.

decBusMulticastFwdRowStatus.name: decBusMulticastFwdRowStatus
decBusMulticastFwdRowStatus.description: An object provided to satisfy the requirement that all tables have at least one accessible object; in the future, it may also be extended to provide PVC support.

decBusCallStatsTable.name: decBusCallStatsTable
decBusCallStatsTable.description: This table holds statistics on virtual circuit/leaf establishment attempts. It contains one row for each Broadcast and Unknown Server, and acts as an extension to the 'decBusConfigTable'.

decBusCallStatsEntry.name: decBusCallStatsEntry
decBusCallStatsEntry.description: Each row contains connection statistics for one Broadcast and Unknown Server.

decBusMulticastSendCalls.name: decBusMulticastSendCalls
decBusMulticastSendCalls.description: The total number of Multicast Send establishment attempts for this BUS component.

decBusMulticastSendFailures.name: decBusMulticastSendFailures
decBusMulticastSendFailures.description: The number of Multicast Send establishment attempts for this BUS component which were not accepted. This includes failures counted in decBusMsOutOfResourcesFailures decBusMsInvalidInfoElements decBusMsWrongLanTypes decBusMsWrongMaxFrameSizes and any miscellaneous failures.

decBusMsOutOfResourcesFailures.name: decBusMsOutOfResourcesFailures
decBusMsOutOfResourcesFailures.description: The number of Multicast Send establishment attempts for this BUS component which failed for lack of resources.

decBusMsInvalidInfoElements.name: decBusMsInvalidInfoElements
decBusMsInvalidInfoElements.description: The number of Multicast Send establishment attempts for this BUS component which failed because required information elements were missing or contained invalid information. The optional Event Log group can help you determine which information elements were invalid or missing. This object does not count call failures included in decBusMsWrongLanTypes or decBusMsWrongMaxFrameSizes.

decBusMsWrongLanTypes.name: decBusMsWrongLanTypes
decBusMsWrongLanTypes.description: The number of Multicast Send establishment attempts which were rejected because they specified a different LAN Type (data frame format) than the one configured for this BUS component.

decBusMsWrongMaxFrameSizes.name: decBusMsWrongMaxFrameSizes
decBusMsWrongMaxFrameSizes.description: The number of Multicast Send establishment attempts which were rejected because they specified a different maximum AAL-5 SDU size than the one configured for this BUS component.

decBusMulticastForwardCalls.name: decBusMulticastForwardCalls
decBusMulticastForwardCalls.description: The number of Multicast Forward connections which this BUS tried to establish.

decBusMulticastForwardFailures.name: decBusMulticastForwardFailures
decBusMulticastForwardFailures.description: The number of Multicast Forward connections which this BUS was unable to establish. This includes failures counted in decBusMfOutOfResourcesFailures decBusMfClientRejects and any miscellaneous failures.

decBusMfOutOfResourcesFailures.name: decBusMfOutOfResourcesFailures
decBusMfOutOfResourcesFailures.description: The number of Multicast Forward connections which this BUS component could not establish due to lack of resources.

decBusMfClientRejects.name: decBusMfClientRejects
decBusMfClientRejects.description: The number of Multicast Forward connections which this BUS component's clients refused to accept.

decBusEventLogMaximumSize.name: decBusEventLogMaximumSize
decBusEventLogMaximumSize.description: The minimum number of events which the agent should remember before purging old log entries to make way for new ones.

decBusEventLogTable.name: decBusEventLogTable
decBusEventLogTable.description: A table of event log entries for the emulated LANs that this node serves.

decBusEventLogEntry.name: decBusEventLogEntry
decBusEventLogEntry.description: An entry describing a significant event.

decBusEventIndex.name: decBusEventIndex
decBusEventIndex.description: A unique number greater than zero which identifies this table row.

decBusEventType.name: decBusEventType
decBusEventType.description: The event which triggered this log entry. joinFailed(1) - A client tried to join one of the broadcast domains which this host serves, but the attempt failed.

decBusEventServer.name: decBusEventServer
decBusEventServer.description: The 'decBusIndex' of the LAN Emulation Server that was involved in this incident. If the value of this object is zero, it indicates that the server no longer exists.

decBusEventServerAtmAddress.name: decBusEventServerAtmAddress
decBusEventServerAtmAddress.description: The ATM address of the Broadcast and Unknown Server that was involved in this incident.

decBusEventClientAtmAddress.name: decBusEventClientAtmAddress
decBusEventClientAtmAddress.description: If known, the ATM address of the LAN Emulation Client that was involved in this incident.

decBusEventTimestamp.name: decBusEventTimestamp
decBusEventTimestamp.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time that the event occurred. If the event occurred prior to the last re-initialization of the local network management subsystem, this object contains a zero value.

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Tue Apr 20 16:00:54 2021
